result.execSummary:
The defendant John J Arvoy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Total court costs paid in full out of bail.

AMENDED 2/13/2015: In order to ensure compliance with treatment obligations, provided that either (1) Defendant at his own cost would have an electronic monitoring device installed or (2) Defendant ensures that his father Joseph J. Arvoy is present at the time he leaves the jail and at the time he returns, the court grants the Defendant privileges under Wis. Stat. 303.08. The courts determination under Wis. Stat. 303.08 is based upon the requirement that the Defendant himself must satisfy either condition (1) or (2) above. The Sheriff has no obligation of any kind with respect to either condition.

Absolute sobriety.
AODA assessment and any follow-up counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
GPS Monitoring.
Pay supervision fees.

Total restitution paid in full out of bail.

The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Defendant John J Arvoy in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Defendant in custody. Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail.  Waive reading of felony complaint. State requests $2000 cash with conditions. Response by Atty Schoenfeldt and requests count 1 be dismissed. Defense requests $500 cash bail.   Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Status conference scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
